232yds/142g the long sample is in the colorway brownie and the short sample is note 1 you can easily alter this pattern to be in the colorway spice longer or shorter by adding or removing repeats of rounds 1-6 needles note 2 it s implied that you will always slip the us 8 5 0 mm 16″or 24″ 40 or 60 cm circular beginning of round stitch marker when you needles come to it or size needed to match gauge abbreviations other materials >> bobble = bind off yarn needle stitch marker >> co = cast on >> k = knit k2 = knit 2 gauge >> p = purl p2 = purl 2 openwork rib stitch see below >> pm = place marker worked in the round >> skp = slip knit pass the slipped stitch over 18 sts / 25 rounds = 4″ 10 cm single decrease >> sm = slip marker from one needle to the next openwork rib stitch >> st s = stitch es note work in the round >> yo = yarn over multiple of 4 stitches rounds 1-5 *k2 p2 repeat from * around round 6 *yo skp p2 repeat from * around sizing rounded to the nearest 0 25″ 0 5 cm circumference 25 75″ 65 5 cm length a shorter 8 5″ 21 5 cm length b longer 12 25″ 31 cm note in the pattern the instructions will be written for length a b example work 7 11 repeats would be 7 for length a and 11 for length b more free patterns ivy cardigan | glen echobaby blanket | kodiak cowl | havre cowl popular paid for patterns lofoten sweater | glymur socks | little thun baby sweater | vale beanie | banff cardigan 2021 ©the blue mouse cascadescowl |the blue mouse knits choosing yarn joanns -
